Sentence.sentence: Yet later on, the more affluent children end up in college and on the way to the middle class, while working-class children tend to struggle.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One of the largest feeders for high school math competitions—including those that eventually lead to the IMO—is a middle school program called MathCounts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Nearly all members of last year's winning U.S.IMO team took part in MathCounts as middle school students, as did Loh, the coach.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Middle-class and higher-income parents see their children as projects in need of careful cultivation, says Annette Lareau, whose groundbreaking research on the topic was published in her book Unequal Childhoods: Class, Race and Family Life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Middle school is an important age because students have enough math capability to solve advanced problems, but they haven't really decided what they want to do with their lives, said Loh.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Middle school is a crucial period when students may become keenly interested in advanced mathematics.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Meanwhile, growing income inequality has coincided with the increasing importance of a college degree for earning a middle-class wage.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the past few years, MathCounts added two new middle school programs to try to diversify its participant pool—the National Math Club and the Math Video Challenge.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the Pew survey, middle-class families earning between $30,000 and $75,000 a year fell right between working-class and high-earning parents on issues like the quality of their neighborhood for raising children, participation in extracurricular activities and involvement in their children's education.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Even Africa and the Middle East, home to economies that are heavily dependent on fossil fuel exports, have enormous potential to develop renewables.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But will such contests, which are overwhelmingly dominated by Asian and white students from middle-class and affluent families become any more diverse? Many social and cultural factors play roles in determining which promising students get on the path toward international math recognition.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That was as it should be: kitchens were for servants, and the aspiring middle classes wanted nothing to do with them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rising more than 1,000 feet in the middle of the gently rolling plains of Wyoming, the massive column of rock looks as though it was dropped down into this location from a different time and place.

Sentence.sentence: These students need to build skills and knowledge during college if they are to use their degrees as a stepping- stone to middle-class mobility.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: So what factors, at the community level, do predict if poor children will move up the economic ladder as adults? What explains, for instance, why the Salt Lake City metro area is one of the 100 largest metropolitan areas most likely to lift the fortunes of the poor and the Atlanta metro area is one of the least likely?Harvard economist Raj Chetty has pointed to economic and racial segregation, community density, the size of a community's middle class, the quality of schools, community religiosity, and family structure, which he calls the single strongest correlate of upward mobility.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is important to increase the size of the middle class.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Despite the ease with which the rich can acquire almost anything they desire, they are just as likely to be unhappy as the middle classes.

Sentence.sentence: He lived outside conventional ideas, he implied, because "I live alone mostly, in the middle of nowhere.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Contrast this middle path with America and Europe, which have each gone ideologically over-board in their own ways.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In it the majority of students will have conformed to the standard model of the time: male, middle class and Western.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"中心"之意。
means: center ： 指三维空间的中心点，也可比喻抽象事物的中心。
middle ： 一般指时间、空间或过程两端间等距的部分。
heart ： 指事物最内部或最重要的部分，表地理位置时可与center换用。
core ： 指某事物固定的中心部分或最重要的核心部分。比喻意义指某物的精华。
midst ： 书面语用词，指在一个群体的深处或在某活动的进程中。

stems_affixes.word_buile: mid中间+dle→n.中间, 当中 adj.中间的, 中部的
mid中间+day日→一天的中间→正午
mid中间+dle→n.中间, 当中 adj.中间的, 中部的

jx.jx_en_mean: divided or dividing something equally into two parts
engaged in or in the process of doing something
(informal)a place that is very remote and isolated
adopt a policy which avoids extremes

entry.def: The middle of something is the part of it that is furthest from its edges, ends, or outside surface.

example.ex: Howard stood in the middle of the room sipping a cup of coffee...
example.tran: 霍华德站在房间中央，小口抿着一杯咖啡。

example.ex: Hyde accelerated away from the kerb, swerving out into the middle of the street...
example.tran: 海德加速驶离路边，突然向街道中央一个急转弯。

entry.def: The middle object in a row of objects is the one that has an equal number of objects on each side.

example.ex: The middle button of his uniform jacket was strained over his belly.
example.tran: 制服上装中间的纽扣在他的肚子上绷得紧紧的。

example.ex: ...the middle finger of her left hand.

entry.def: Your middle is the part of your body around your stomach.

example.ex: At age fifty-three, he now has a few extra pounds around his middle...
The cook's apron covered her middle.
example.tran: 厨用围裙裹着她的腰部。

entry.def: The middle of an event or period of time is the part that comes after the first part and before the last part.

example.ex: I woke up in the middle of the night and could hear a tapping on the window...
example.tran: 我半夜里醒来，听见有敲窗户的声音。

example.ex: It was now the middle of November, cold and often foggy...
example.tran: 现在是11月中旬，天气寒冷而且经常有雾。

entry.def: If someone is in their middle thirties, for example, they are aged somewhere approximately between thirty-four and thirty-six.

example.ex: She knew he was in his middle fifties, although he looked much younger...
example.tran: 尽管他看上去年轻得多，她知道他在55岁左右。

example.ex: I went on competing till I was in my middle forties.
example.tran: 我继续参赛，直到45岁左右。

entry.def: The middle child in a family has equal numbers of younger and older brothers and sisters.
entry.tran: (兄弟姐妹中)年龄居中的，排行居中的

example.ex: His middle son died in a drowning accident five years back.
example.tran: 他排行居中的那个儿子5年前意外溺水身亡。

entry.def: The middle course or way is a moderate course of action that lies between two opposite and extreme courses.
entry.tran: 折中的;中庸之道的;不走极端的

example.ex: He favoured a middle course between free enterprise and state intervention...
example.tran: 他更倾向于在自由经营与国家干预之间走一条中庸之道。

example.ex: The Mayor of Jerusalem has tried to minimise conflict by maintaining a middle way between the various religions.
example.tran: 耶路撒冷市市长对各宗教采取折中的态度，力图使冲突最小化。

entry.def: If you divide or split something down the middle, you divide or split it into two equal halves or groups.

example.ex: They agreed to split the bill down the middle...
If the conservatives are not removed, then the party will almost certainly split down the middle.
example.tran: 如果不除掉保守势力，那么这个党几乎肯定会分裂成两派。

entry.def: If you are in the middle of doing something, you are busy doing it.

example.ex: It's a bit hectic. I'm in the middle of cooking for nine people...
example.tran: 我正忙着为9个人做饭呢，有点儿忙不过来。

example.ex: He was always in the middle of a business transaction.

means.word_mean: 1. an area that is approximately central within some larger region;

sentences.sentence: "it is in the center of town"
"they ran forward into the heart of the struggle"
"they were in the eye of the storm"
"A whole is that which has beginning, middle, and end"- Aristotle

means.word_mean: 3. the middle area of the human torso (usually in front);

sentences.sentence: "young American women believe that a bare midriff is fashionable"

means.word_mean: 4. time between the beginning and the end of a temporal period;
1. being neither at the beginning nor at the end in a series;
3. of a stage in the development of a language or literature between earlier and later stages;

sentences.sentence: "Middle English is the English language from about 1100 to 1500"

means.word_mean: 4. between an earlier and a later period of time;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English middel, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch middel and German Mittel, also to mid

Sentence.sentence: The middle-aged person, Barth continued, can see death in the distance, but moves with a measured haste to get big new things done while there is still time.

Sentence.sentence: Life Reimagined paints a picture of middle age that is far from gloomy.
